data.question: What is the space group of compound 1?
What is the magnetic moment calculated for compound 1?
What is the Weiss constant for compound 2?
What type of interactions mediate the magnetic frustration in compounds 1 and 2?
data.answer: Competing F and AF interactions mediate by V–F–V and V–F–Cu bonds

data.question: What is the frustration index of compound 1?
What is the role of cis-edge or -corner sharing metal-centered octahedra in the synthesis of new materials?
data.answer: They enable interesting frustrated spin lattices to be targeted

data.question: Does the magnetic frustration index of compound 1 indicate strong frustration?
data.answer: Yes, materials with f > 5–10 indicate strong frustration, and compound 1 has a frustration index larger than 9

data.question: Is the magnetic moment of compound 2 in agreement with theoretical values?
data.answer: Yes, the magnetic moment of 2.62 μB is in agreement with the theoretical value of 2.45 μB

data.question: Are the triangular motifs in compounds 1 and 2 the same?
data.answer: Yes, both compounds are built from the same triangular spin-1/2 “CuV2” fragments

data.question: Does the synthesis method affect the formation of “CuV2” triangular fragments?
data.answer: No, the formation of “CuV2” triangular fragments is not affected by the synthesis method

data.question: Is the magnetic frustration in compound 1 equivalent to that of materials synthesized using SBUs?
data.answer: Yes, the magnetic frustration of compound 1 is equivalent to the frustration of materials synthesized using SBUs

data.question: Do compounds 1 and 2 exhibit long-range frustration?
data.answer: Yes, both compounds exhibit long-range frustration

data.question: Is the space group of compound 2 P21/c?
